description: A small town in central Slovakia.

activities.activity: Explore the village of Nitrianske Pravno
activities.description: Wander through the village center to see historic buildings and the local culture.

activities.activity: Roman Catholic Parish Church of St. John the Baptist's Martyrdom
activities.description: The original stone Gothic church were laid at the end of the 14th century, reflecting the economic prosperity of the local mines at that time.
Explore this historical and sacral site, which offers serene views and a sense of local heritage.

activities.activity: Hike in the Strážov Mountains Protected Landscape Area
activities.description: Discover numerous marked trails for hiking and cycling in the beautiful surrounding nature.
Located on SNP Square in a reconstructed historic building, this museum documents the history and life of the Carpathian Germans in the Horná Nitra region.
Enjoy swimming, fishing, or simply relaxing by the water at this nearby lake, a popular spot for holidaymakers.
Hike to the top of Vyšehrad Hill (829 m asl) for panoramic views of the surrounding area.
Visit one of Central Europe's most famous and picturesque castles, known for its fairy-tale appearance, museum, and park.
Go underground to the natural travertine cave located beneath the fourth courtyard of Bojnice Castle.
Explore the oldest zoo in Slovakia, home to over 360 animal species, situated in a beautiful setting next to the castle.
Climb the 30-meter high tower for stunning views of the castle, the town of Prievidza, and the surrounding valley. It also features a fun slide.
Step back in time at this museum located in the original Neanderthal site of the Prepoštská cave.
Unwind in the thermal pools, which use natural water with temperatures between 26 to 33°C.
Enjoy interactive exhibits and games focused on optical illusions, a fun activity for all ages.
Take a short drive to this unique village famous for its traditional wooden houses with decorative white patterns, offering an authentic cultural immersion.
Wander through the historic central square of Žilina, known for its colorful burgher houses, fountain, and the statue of Immaculata.
Tour this picturesque 13th-century castle set in a large park at the confluence of the Váh and Kysuca rivers, which also hosts the Považie Museum focusing on regional history.

activities.activity: Hike to Lietava Castle Lietava ruins
activities.description: Take a short hike to one of Slovakia's largest and most impressive castle ruins, offering spectacular views of the surrounding countryside.
Go on a guided tour through the mysterious underground cellars and corridors beneath Mariánske Square, dating back to the 15th century.

activities.activity: Walk in the Park of Ľudovít Štúr
activities.description: Relax in this well-maintained city park, which features a fountain, playgrounds, workout areas, and picnic spots, suitable for all ages.
Discover stunning natural scenery and diverse hiking trails (ranging from easy to hard), including the popular Jánošíkové Diery gorge.

activities.activity: Visit the unique village of Čičmany
activities.description: Take a day trip to this world-famous village known for its traditional wooden houses decorated with distinctive white geometric patterns.
Visit one of the most dramatic and best-preserved medieval castles in Slovakia, perched on a steep cliff 100 meters above the Orava River.

activities.activity: Visit the Slovak Bethlehem in Rajecká Lesná
activities.description: See an intricate and large wooden nativity scene (crib), which is a remarkable piece of folk art.
Unwind in the thermal pools and spa facilities of the nearby Spa Aphrodite Rajecké Teplice.
Visit this scenic valley in the Malá Fatra National Park for hiking, nature walks, or winter sports, with options to take a cable car up a peak.

activities.activity: See the Cathedral of the Holy Trinity
activities.description: Visit this prominent Gothic church in the pedestrian zone of Žilina, known for its historical significance and architecture.

activities.activity: Go to the Lookout Tower Dubeň
activities.description: Hike or drive to this lookout tower near Žilina for excellent views of the city, the surrounding mountains, and the Budatín Castle area.

activities.activity: Visit the Museum of the Slovak Village (Martin)
activities.description: Explore the largest open-air museum in Slovakia (an easy day trip to Martin), showcasing traditional folk architecture and life in the region.
Visit this converted train station that now functions as a vibrant independent cultural center for concerts, theater, workshops, and discussions.
